meanings.definition: In a manner showing no moral principles; dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: He unscrupulously cheated on the test by looking at his neighbor's paper.
meanings.sent2: The businessman unscrupulously embezzled money from the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat unscrupulously stole the fish from the kitchen counter when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The virus unscrupulously infiltrated the computer system, corrupting all the files.
meanings.sent5: The thief unscrupulously picked the lock and entered the house undetected.

meanings.definition: Acting without regard for what is right or fair.
meanings.sent1: The unscrupulous salesman tricked customers into buying faulty products.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her unscrupulous behavior in the competitive industry.
meanings.sent3: The unscrupulous squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His unscrupulous actions left a trail of chaos and mistrust in the community.
meanings.sent5: The unscrupulous politician made false promises to gain votes.
